content:
Hey there :wave:

It's been a while since we started this space and there's been some discussion on here as well as the github issues.
I think generally having some broad-scope coordination meetings, at least in the beginning are gonna be a good idea. And I think zulip is also a great place to have them.

I made a doodle for times: https://dudle.inf.tu-dresden.de/Rust_database-wg_kickoff_meeting/ (all times in UTC!)

From existing conversations I think a good starting agenda would be

1. Database adapters team (writing sync/async database adapters and common APIs)
2. A minimal migrations toolkit (around barrel)
3. Roadmap for database testing tools
Feel free to post your own agenda wishes below
I'm based in Sydney, but would prefer to work morning Canadian time so I can dial in that part of my team =)

:grimacing: Yea a bunch of stuff slipped my mind this week. But there wasn't a lot of overlap on dates anyway. So maybe we start another doodle next week with some more date ranges and see if we can't find a better time. Sorry!
I'm based on South Africa, and am comfortable with anything between 10:00GMT - 18:00GMT
@spacekookie Any news on this?
@weiznich @spacekookie has anything happened yet? I would like to help.
As far as I'm aware nothing has happened.

Hey, yea. I've had to take some time off from everything. I'll create a doodle next week for a date where we can all talk about what we want to do, and how to coordinate.

I know that the refinary repo has seen some commits to build a more flexible migration engine, which I haven't used personally yet.
But also like...don't let me stop you from doing stuff you want to in some repo or whatever
@weiznich @spacekookie I think we should start doing a monthly meeting regularly for this group. Like how #wg-cli is doing.
I currently do not have the bandwidth for regular meetings. Feel free to do such a thing, but don't expected that I will participate regularly.
Well, the problem with regular meetings in this space was that I couldn't even get anyone to really care enough about working out scope of the group x) so, not sure how useful they would be
I can't lead them, but I'd be sitting in if any happened
I think we should figure out the scope of this group on this chat. I have 2 in mind already:

1. Barrel migrations
  2. Model layer on top of diesel (like Rails ActiveRecord)
I am planning to work on second one anyway
